page.title: 07The Roxy Cinema
page.content: The Mayor of Oldham opened the Roxy in l938. The first manager was Mr. Boddington. One of the two most popular films was "The Sound of Music". Below the Mini-cinema there used to be a restaurant and bar. The Mini-cinema opened with "Jaws" and the Maxi-2 with "Close Encounters". There are now 3 screens in the one building. The whole cinema was built for Â£25,000. The cinema holds 942 people and they come from as far as Bolton to watch the films. There are 15 staff with 3 full-time. Their ratings boosted by 10% when other cinemas closed down. The average number of people who go every week is 2000. In the mini-cinema the films go downstairs, projected by mirrors. The most popular film recently was "Ghostbusters".
